backFields.label: üè† Major Milestone: 12 Units Complete!
backFields.value:
Your Affordable Housing priority just achieved a major milestone - 12 workforce housing units completed and fully occupied in downtown Frederick!

Project: Frederick Workforce Apartments
Total LIFT Contribution: $38,500
Your Share: ~$1,247 (33% of certificate)

Ribbon Cutting Ceremony:
December 8, 2025 @ 2:00 PM
You're invited! RSVP: events@exchangereserve.org

backFields.label: Frederick Workforce Apartments
backFields.value:
Location: 425 W Patrick Street, Frederick
Units: 12 apartments (1BR & 2BR)
Status: ‚úì 100% occupied (Nov 2025)

Affordability:
‚Ä¢ Rent: $900-$1,200/month
‚Ä¢ Target: 60% Area Median Income
‚Ä¢ Below market rate by 40%

Building Features:
‚Ä¢ Historic rehabilitation project
‚Ä¢ Energy efficient (LEED Silver)
‚Ä¢ Transit-oriented location
‚Ä¢ Ground floor retail spaces
‚Ä¢ Community room

This project transformed a vacant historic building into quality affordable housing!

backFields.label: Meet Your Neighbors
backFields.value:
12 families now call this home:

‚Ä¢ 5 single parents with children
‚Ä¢ 3 seniors on fixed income
‚Ä¢ 2 young professional couples
‚Ä¢ 2 essential workers (nurse, teacher)

Average household:
‚Ä¢ Income: $32,000-$48,000/year
‚Ä¢ Rent savings: $600/month vs market
‚Ä¢ Within walking distance of work

"This apartment changed my life. As a single mom, I couldn't find anything affordable near my job. Now I'm 10 minutes from work and my daughter's school." - Sarah M., Resident

Your LIFT certificate directly helped house these families!

backFields.label: üìä How Your Funding Worked
backFields.value:
Total Project Cost: $2.4 million

Funding Structure:
‚Ä¢ LIFT Pool: $38,500 (1.6%)
‚Ä¢ Community Development Loan: $500,000
‚Ä¢ Tax Credit Equity: $1,200,000
‚Ä¢ Developer Equity: $400,000
‚Ä¢ City Grant: $261,500

Your $1,247 share helped leverage $75,000 in additional funding - a 60:1 ratio!

This is the power of pooled regenerative capital - small contributions create big impact.
